section.section:
The Board of Public Works may approve payment of a settlement, a judgment, or counsel fees under Subtitles 3 and 4 of this title with or without a hearing, and direct payment from:
money appropriated for that purpose in the State budget;
money appropriated to the State Insurance Trust Fund for that purpose; or
the General Emergency Fund.
The Board may direct that payment be made in lump sum or in installments.
If the Board disapproves payment in whole or in part, the Board shall state in writing its reasons for disapproval.
Decisions under this title are not subject to judicial review.
Nothing in this section shall be construed as a waiver of sovereign immunity of the State, any of its units, or State personnel.
If the Board directs payment under paragraph (2) of this subsection, such payment shall be collected in the manner provided by § 7-222 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.

text.section: The Board of Public Works may delegate to affected units, in consultation with the Attorney General, authority to pay, from the funds of that unit available for the purpose, settlements, judgments, and counsel fees that do not exceed $10,000 in a particular case.
